name: treatment of waste polyvinylchloride, open burning | waste polyvinylchloride | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/17532/documentation

This dataset represents the activity of waste disposal of 'waste polyvinylchloride' in uncontrolled, open burning. Recommended use of this dataset: uncontrolled disposal of the waste through burning. Inventoried waste consists of fraction: 100% PVC. Waste composition (wet, in ppmw): gross heating value 21.67 MJ/kg; net heating value 21.51 MJ/kg; H2O 2000; O 16911; H 54921; C 440610; S 1057; N 1057; P na; B na; Cl 475290; Br 73.839; F 15.506; I na; Ag na; As 2.0042; Ba 196.73; Cd 2.7546; Co 33.322; Cr 43.106; Cu 28.223; Hg 0.89569; Mn 84.301; Mo na; Ni 21.729; Pb 16.002; Sb 45.323; Se 2.2152; Sn 391.41; V 303.95; Zn 59.775; Be 0.52742; Sc na; Sr 93.353; Ti 1054.8; Tl 0.42194; W na; Si na; Fe 3930; Ca na; Al 210.97; K na; Mg na; Na 1545.9. Share of carbon in waste that is biogenic 0%. Recycling rates for metallic iron = 0% for metallic aluminium = 0% for metallic copper = 0% . A mass of 0.25 kg residues are left on ground.

The activity starts with the waste being available at the location (gate) of the uncontrolled disposal. Collection and transportation of the waste to the uncontrolled disposal location is not included.

The activity ends with the waste being disposed, in an uncontrolled manner and waste-specific emissions from open burning are released to the environment (air and soil).
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

processDocumentation.timeDescription: This dataset represents a generic open burning without any temporal distinction.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Modelling parameters representing a generic open burning process, not geographical specific.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This is an inventory for open burning of solid waste, representing an informal and uncontrolled burning. No flue gas treatment. Suitable for informal recycling or disposal. Based on Municipal waste incineration without any pollution control. Residues (minus any actually recycled metals) are left on site. Assumption of share of thermal NOx to total NOx in average waste burning process is 30%. Contribution from thermal NOx is 810mg per kg waste. Recycling rates for metallic iron = 0% for metallic aluminium = 0% for metallic copper = 0%.
